meanings.definition: To extend the duration or length of something.
meanings.sent1: She prologed her vacation by a few days to spend more time with her family.
meanings.sent2: The teacher prologed the class by adding extra activities at the end.
meanings.sent3: The prologed meeting made everyone happy as they got to chat longer.
meanings.sent4: His speech prologed into the night, captivating the audience with his stories.
meanings.sent5: The prologed movie marathon lasted until the early hours of the morning.

meanings.definition: To delay or prolong an event or process.
meanings.sent1: They prologed the decision-making process by discussing every detail repeatedly.
meanings.sent2: The traffic jam prologed their journey, making them late for the appointment.
meanings.sent3: The prologed rain delay at the game caused frustration among the players.
meanings.sent4: Her procrastination prologed the completion of the project, causing stress.
meanings.sent5: The repair work on the road was prologed due to unexpected complications.
